Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Yes, there will be other goods once they manage to establish their name. Their initial aim was to act as a social marketplace, so there will be other products as well. I am not sure I remember correctly, but I think there was a discussion that they'll also add what community suggested, like high-end sneakers, branded bags, etc.  Quote from: FIEX on January 14, 2019, 09:46:06 AM Quote from: GayOfThrones on January 13, 2019, 09:17:34 PM It looks like the team is going a good job in the real world. Any idea when SOMA is going to go beyond watches to the next stage?  After our pilot project we will go beyond watches. During our pilot we will be focussing a part of our business development team to other luxury brands.

Author: republicrypto
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: any big news coming to SOMA ? because coinmarketcap show a huge price movements    regards

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: We had a lot of news/progress the last months but dont do any updates anymore here on BitcoinTalk.  Where is SOMA at this moment: - We started with our Cohort 1 onboarding (first 100 users on our platform) - They start buying watches next week, after Cohort 1 there will be Cohort 2 (500 users) - We have +150 brands signed, included some big premium watch brands - Our waiting list for joining the platform is now +11000 users  We are not focussing on the crypto market for the moment, so no marketing there. If you have any specific questions, let me know.

Author: ningrum
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Thank you for providing news about SOMA and if we look at the news I think the team really works, and in my opinion what needs to be underlined is that for now the SOMA team is not focused on the crypto market

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Correct! Crypto market will not be buying the watches, except the people in crypto who are also interested in watches. Only watch enthusiast and users interested in watches will use our platform for now.  After this crypto market will use our tokens as investment or when we launch our reseller function.

Author: lvsca
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: well, really big news after long time didn't get any update. any plan for crypto in the future? special bounty, maybe?

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: There has been a lot of updates just not here on Bitcointalk. You can follow us on other channels.  Yes we will be focussing on the crypto market after we launch for public. After the public launch we have around 10k users (90% non-crypto-users) on our marketplace and will then introduce the token to our community.  A bounty is always possible but hasn't been on our agenda for now. As soon I have updates for the crypto community I will announce them here.

Author: DenysM
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: No one wants to buy/sell this token. There are 2.6 million tokens on cryptopies and until this exchange opens, no one will pull the price up. On latoken no liquidity and trading. This exchange is washing up the volume. I am surprised why you do not see it!? On this exchange, there were never purchase orders for 0.00021 ETH. If you pay attention then the maximum is 0.00016 eth. The exchange artificially shows a rise in price, but there are no buy orders. I do not know how to explain this to you because English is not my native language.   The difference between buying and selling is doubled. The exchange buys orders from itself by 0.000011btc and thus shows that the price is rising. The next day they sell at 0.000005 and show that the price falls. Bring volume to more than 50 thousand dollars so that this token was shown on the CMC by the Gainers & Losers   But if we look here we will see that there are no transactions. https://ethplorer.io/address/0x63b992e6246d88f07fc35a056d2c365e6d441a3d#pageSize=100 I only see someone collecting 1.3 token from different wallets. Probably when the team handed out free coins someone registered several hundred wallets and now collects all the coins in one wallet

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: We just dont know what the future will bring. It's always possible Ethereum will split or stop with developments, ...  We will develope our project on the Ethereum blockchain. We are coordinating possibilities for the future. Other blockchains could be used for functionalities that needs to be highly scalable in case Ethereum network would encounter scalability problems. Our tech team is working out how this can be used in the future. There will be an announcement about this later. But our utility tokens will stay on Ethereum!

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Dont be mad at us during these bear markets DenysM. Sorry if your investment didnt go 20x or 100x. We are working hard and soon we will have more news.  First you talk about SOMA being the next pump and now you are telling we are lairs and manipulating the markets? https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3027211.0  ARCHIVE: http://web.archive.org/web/20181106204941/https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3027211.0 http://web.archive.org/web/20181106205028/https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3027211.20  Also doing this in the Russian thread? Soon you will see your returns in better market conditions and when we release our pilot project.  Quote SOMA's approach is that we are not a cryptocurrency but rather a tech startup. Yes, we have an internal currency, but that's not even the most exciting aspect. It's just a tool to drive the overall ecosystem. One component.  We know that our SCT holders are primarily interested in the token and its value, but hear us out. Most tokens have zero value. People just don't realize it yet. SCT will have zero value if we don't build a business model that catches on. And if we do build a business model that catches on, SCT will have tremendous value because of its constrained supply.  SOMA is holding large amounts of SCT strategically to distribute to partners. This is part of our growth strategy. In the long run, what's good for SOMA is good for investors. Most tokens will go to zero because they won't find adoption. SOMA is already finding adoption, and this distribution strategy is a key part of our roadmap forward.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Update  What does SOMA stand for? Read about our company values in this link: https://soma.co/values-and-standards/  #blockchain #capitalism #environment #diversity #meritocracy #ecommerce #retail #corporatevalues #cryptocurrency  Environmental stewardship SOMA recognizes that we live on a beautiful planet with finite resources. That's one of the reasons our technology focuses on linking the secondary market with the primary market: we want to encourage 'downcycling' to divert products from the landfill. And, of course, we promote recycling, energy-efficiency, reduced travel when appropriate, and other eco-friendly measures.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I think you and I know that those meme coins will not have a long term future? SOMA's approach is that we are not a cryptocurrency but rather a tech startup. Yes, we have an internal currency, but that's not even the most exciting aspect. It's just a tool to drive the overall ecosystem. It's just one component.  The value will increase after more adoption and that's what we are aiming for at this stage. Looking for partnerships, pitching at companies, ...  First of all focussing on the developments of our platform for our pilot project launch. This is just phase one!

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: People are always talking about bigger exchanges but this will do nothing for the project! This will add zero value to the product. Why?  We are focussing on partners now for our launch in Q1 2019, all those partners we are gathering are interested in the technology and dont have any or little experience with exchanges. They dont partner because we have a token with high value but because we are making something they are interested in, something they can use! Isnt that what all projects want? A product companies will use, people will use, ...  Exchanges will not make people use our token. When the platform has more adoption and more and more people are using it than our token is needed and then we can focus on bigger exchanges.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: You still need to have SCT to promote you product on the platform and thats only possible with SCT tokens. In the future there will be packages available for big companies for putting their products on the platform and these can only be bought with SCT tokens.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: On LAToken we have an ETH pair. Cryptopia only has a BTC pair for SCT tokens.  LAToken is a great exchanges, we had a meeting the founders and supporting their future vision. There are so many exchanges out there, not possible to know all of them.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: You can download the beta app on Google play, read all about it in this article: https://medium.com/@soma_sct/soma-mvp-launch-83a1a3aca6f8  Yes it will be possible to buy the watches with SCT tokens, SCT tokens can also be used for promoting your items on the platform.  Why only watches: We were looking for a niche market to test our pilot program and protocol. The luxury watchindustry is great for our pilot. After this pilot we will focus on other markets.  Remember: this is just the start! We start small with the focus on luxury watches and then we will expand!

Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Would you consider high-end bags and shoes after this? As we know, there are lots of spi-offs for luxury bags and shoes, this probably can be an appealing factor if SOMA can facilitate someone who look for a second hand branded goods without the worry of fake products

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Sure! We are open for all kind of goods in the luxury market. During this pilot project we will analyse all kind of markets for the next step.  Any suggestions are welcome!

Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I see only fake volume. Nobody buys this token, the team creates the appearance of bidding. I only see how the team throws out hundreds of thousands of tokens every month. They washed 1 million volume, but the price did not increase a cent))) Volume of 1 million dollars but the capitalization of 500 thousand dollars))   Then they do the same with the purchase. They make fake volumes for more than two months and you can see this on CMC. I see the real price and volume only on cryptopia   Do they think hamsters will pull the price up? I think that a large speculator will not push the price up, because the team sends hundreds of thousands of tokens to its partners every month. Why would a big speculator take this blow? Too many tokens holding a few people. Why should a big speculator create conditions for good sales for them!?

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Thanks for your feedback. SOMA is much more than an ecommerce marketplace, as you will see when you read our whitepaper (link below). This particular post references the applicability of our Heimdall Protocol for industrial and enterprise applications to combat counterfeiting: specifically for this article, in the aerospace/aviation industry. It represents a prime use case for SOMA, given that the need is very real. Too many crypto projects are a solution in search of a problem, but SOMA is the rare project addressing a massive problem that truly needs a solution.  Our Whitepaper: https://soma.co/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/SOMA_Whitepaper.pdf

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: That's what we are aiming for! This is also the reason why we are using all our funds in developments and not on listing fees, we believe that SOMA can deliver a great product. Exchanges will follow. It will be a long road, but we have time, no?

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: You can follow us on Medium where you can found all our articles.  Medium: https://medium.com/@soma_sct  We will add some extra articles later this week on our business blog: https://medium.com/somabusiness   We are now working on getting the round 2 funding from Finland Business. Author: shivansps
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: That's pretty impressive for the money you have collected through ICO. Team dedication has proven this project is more legit than a bunch of money grabs collected a dozen of millions USD. Does your marketplace depend on the Ethereum scaling?

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: No not really.  We will develope our project on the Ethereum blockchain.  We are coordinating possibilities for the future. For example: Credits can be used for functionalities that needs to be highly scalable in case Ethereum network would encounter scalability problems. We are talking with other blockchain projects as well for possible partnerships. Our tech team is working out how these others can be used in the future.  Thanks a lot for your kind words about SOMA!

Body: They are going to try and create a platform for people to exchange goods, but keep in mind that we already have Amazon. I mean Amazon have recently boomed into like the biggest corporation in the world. It's hard for me to imagine someone being able to compete with them, so it can be a huge drawback for just starting platform.

Author: [Maarten]
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Think you are missing the point of our platform. We introduce the Heimdall protocol on our platform and will be focussing on high-end market, we already have partnerships with luxury watchretailers we will use our platform to add their watches on the blockchain.  More info Heimdall protocol: For Enterprise: SOMA's Heimdall Protocol SOMA's Heimdall Protocol ties an item securely to its digital representation on the blockchain. This digital representation provides (a) waypoints and timestamps for key benchmarks or milestones, (b) certificate of ownership and record of chain-of-ownership, (c) authentication of provenance, and (d) a comprehensive repository of all documentation and multimedia associated with the item.

Author: SheldonLeeCooper
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: SOMA re-branding  SOMA‚Äôs ready for a makeover. Up until now, our ‚Äòvibe‚Äô has been that of one of a scrappy, albeit promising, cryptocurrency/blockchain project. Among many scrappy crypto projects. And our branding has worked for that. But‚Ää‚Äî‚Äälet‚Äôs be honest‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit doesn‚Äôt exactly scream ‚Äòenterprise-grade tracking and logistics protocol.‚Äô Nor ‚Äònext-gen peer-to-peer social ecommerce platform.‚Äô Nor ‚Äòthe hottest new site for luxury goods.‚Äô  Because SOMA will be all of those things and more. We have the momentum. We have the funding. And now we need the branding to accompany these objectives. SOMA not a cryptocurrency  We have a cryptocurrency (SCT), and it serves very specific purposes in the SOMA tech stack. But SOMA is so much more than just another ‚Äòaltcoin.‚Äô You might even say that the crypto part is one of the least revolutionary aspects of SOMA. The evolution of ecommerce  SOMA is a hybrid-tech solution that unites the best of blockchain, ecommerce, social media, and existing tech stacks.  Yes, we are built on blockchain.Yes, blockchain is central to our model. But it‚Äôs time to get out of the cryptosphere and compete in the real world.  Stay tuned for SOMA‚Äôs new look, coming in autumn 2018.  https://medium.com/@soma_sct/soma-re-branding-29e9586b4aa2

This scammer was caught in pumps and dumps.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: No need to scream in the red color . Did you read the article? Let me quote it:  Quote A note on the controversy surrounding Gat We at SOMA are aware that Gat has, by his own admission, participated in certain unethical trading activities. SOMA does not condone or endorse in any way the participation in market manipulation, pump and dump groups, or any other unethical or illegal activity.  So, why is SOMA associating itself with Gat?  Simple: we believe in second chances. Gat made a mistake and has admitted as much. He did not instigate the activity, and has an otherwise stellar reputation in the cryptosphere. These facts lead us to believe that this was an isolated indiscretion. If we believed otherwise, we would not associate the SOMA brand with him.  Gat has been a tireless proponent of cryptocurrency technology and has given away his considerable knowledge to others in his his free Telegram groups and via his YouTube channel. Members of the SOMA team have followed him long before the recent scandal and have observed him to be a selfless and aboveboard person.  We‚Äôre ready to let bygones be bygones and allow Gat to demonstrate that he has, indeed, learned a valuable lesson which he will not repeat.  The whole market is fallen! No need for fudding now but supporting!

Don't you see obvious things? I will describe the whole situation. Let the community look and tell which of us is right and who is a fraudster.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: This has already been discussed on Telegram and explained by the CEO Jukka: The new tokens in circulation are for key person incentivization. Practically this means our new board members. They receive their compensation 100% in SCT to keep their incentives aligned with the company. However, they have strict rules regarding lock-up, so these tokens are not coming to circulation yet.  We also paid for our future airdrops to the platforms (Ethos, AirdropX). All these extra tokens are not yet in circulation so this is not the reason!

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Update  SOMA USP, Part I: the Heimdall Protocol This is Part I of a multipart series that lays out SOMA‚Äôs unique selling proposition (USP) and competitive advantages.  Heimdall Protocol SOMA‚Äôs Interactive Item Card (IIC) is a protocol that provides a clear competitive advantage over other marketplaces and establishes our brand as a leader in the tracking of provenance and history of ownership. Soma has chosen to brand the IIC with the more charismatic title of Heimdall Protocol, after the character from Scandinavian mythology (Soma is headquartered in Helsinki).  More info about our Heimdall Protocol you can read in our latest Medium post: https://medium.com/@soma_sct/soma-usp-part-i-the-heimdall-protocol-cd23f02b0f45

Body: "Soma: Our devs are working furiously to get our MVP ready" added for voting, proof and forecast on YEENOT TODAY https://yeenot.today/catalog/news/255 Looking forward to the growth of the community?  Why Soma is a gem : ¬∑Social marketplace ¬∑MVP in 2 months ¬∑$1M market cap ¬∑14.4M total supply ¬∑Under the radar (very little marketing efforts until now) ¬∑Big marketing efforts underway (airdrop to launch soon) ¬∑Innovative features(interactive item card is digital innovation)  Airdrop on @Ethos_io. Soma is a revolutionary decentralized platform that facilitates trade and social interaction powered by blockchain technology and a native cryptocurrency (Soma Community Token, or SCT) for liquidity within the Soma Community. By disintermediating the value chain, buyers and sellers can realize greater profits. At the same time, an innovative rewards system incentivizes beneficial collaboration and ensures that value-adding services are compensated. Soma is a free-market ecosystem‚Äîfree of market manipulation, price-fixing, gouging, and bloat.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Hi DenysM  Thanks for your feedback! The price for 1SCT is just below our ICO price, taking the price of ETH in consideration during our ICO. That wasnt the same as it is today.  We told you guys that we had some agreements with exchanges and that wasnt a lie. But we just cant talk about it anymore from our legal team because of SEC. A lot of exchanges cancelled agreements because of SEC. We made Cryptopia happen and at this point this is a very good exchange for the stage we are in now.  There is more news coming from our marketing team and dev team. We are still on schedule with our roadmap so there will be a working MVP this quarter.  If you have any questions you can come to our Telegram channel: https://t.me/SomaCommunity   Best regard FIEX

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Update  Message from Bartosz, Soma CTO:  As you know Soma is much more than just a tradeable token. Team is dedicated to provide truly unique concept of social trading. So I'd like to announce that were close to complete first sprint of Android app. Limited functionality test versions will be available for selected members of community through whole development process.  Work is planned into 4 sprints, there will be weekly build available. I'll start to publish code snippets to GitHUB (Soma-MVP) with regular updates. Web application will also follow with the same functional spec.  As Soma is one these projects that utilizes blockchain technology in real-world application we'd like to be active part of blockchain community. As Poland is one of the countries that is showing government interest, local team is aiming to become part of http://www.akcelerator.tech/en/about-us/ I believe that apart of knowledge sharing this will provide some extra credibility to the project.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: UPDATE - TEAM     Bartosz, 37yr old living in Poland, will be our new CTO. His main responsibility will be supervising the development of our MVP, designing future architecture and giving tech support to the rest of the team. He is educated in the fields of math, physics, teaching, software engineering and finance. He graduated from Poland (Bydgoszcz, ≈Å√≥d≈∫, and Gda≈Ñsk) and in the USA (University at Buffalo).  Over the last 16 years, he has handled different positions within engineering and management, including senior positions on a country level. Bartosz also runs a family company that specializes in intellectual property management. He also works as a volunteer in the Academy of Future ‚Äì a charity organization helping kids achieve their goals.  A side of all his work he is married, has 2 children, plays music, repairing his 23yr old Land Rover Discovery and is training for his first triathlon in July.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: UPDATE - TEAM     Karthik Iyer is CEO, founder and chairman of BlockchainMonk. BlockchainMonk is India's first research oriented advisory firm that specializes in distributed ledger tech, smart contracts and analyzing its disruptive potential in various industries. Karthik was part of one of the largest EU research project on P2P, P2PValue.eu. He has serveral degrees in technology, research and management from leading schools in Europe and Asia. Karthik Iyer is a PhD researcher at the University of Oslo, published close to a dozen papers on mobile and software ecosystems tech.  He is going to speak about SOMA in various events he is keynoting/speaking. He spoke about SOMA during his last speech in Hanoi, Vietnam. People got thrilled about the concept and idea.

Author: KarmaShark
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Good day SOMA community!   My name is Jason Cassidy (https://www.linkedin.com/in/cassidyjason/)  and I am a public figure in the blockchain industry since early 2013. I have worked with the founders of the SOMA project since well before their ICO last year and continue to work with them in the background to this day. I can confirm there are many positive developments taking place including exchange listings (some of which I am assisting on), work towards a release candidate and several other areas including marketing and team development. As you can see, SOMA is adding new talent to their group very rapidly now in anticipation for much bigger things later this year.   The wait time between launching a successful ICO to seeing tangible progress can sometimes be a frustrating endeavour however I am quite happy with what I am seeing from the team and will continue to support them as they work towards releasing a platform that brings real value to the industry.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Update - Tokens are burned!   The total supply is now 14.418.075. The total supply is greater as it includes a liquidity reserve (+3mil tokens). I want to emphasize that the liquidity reserve will not be used for any other purpose than providing liquidity in the event that SCT would not be purchasable from the free market after the launch of our MVP. We keep this event very unlikely, but to ensure smooth functioning of the platform when the onboarding of users begins, it is mandatory to have.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Update - Yobit.net issue  ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è SOMA Compensation | Yobit.net ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è  We want to thank everybody for the patience regarding the issue with Yobit. The current status is that Yobit has transferred this issue to their token maintenance team but with no news after the deadline they gave us. Time for us to do something. Use this form to send us your TX and contact information and we will compensate the full amount! This form will be open for 10 days starting today January 24th 2018, after that it's not possible to get the compensation.  Form can be found here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfXsJp9lb_A1jSbV8cUxylM6-FUQwOKpcb6dCmjNeOv6s7M2Q/viewform

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Before anyone can cheat the system, and I believe there will be some greedy that'll attempt to, you can't create a fake claim by giving false info. The form asked your TX id with bitcointalk username which I believe the team will crosscheck with their spreadsheet distribution as well as making sure there were no similar TX id at their submitted form. So please, let's safe our thread from waves of posts informing FIEX that someone is scamming their stuck amount by not being too greedy and fool enough to think we can rob someone's right

Author: DenysM
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Today I read it in their telegram.    Hello everybody! First of all, we want to thank everybody for the patience regarding the issue with Yobit. The current status is that the Yobit has transferred this issue to their token maintenance team and it should be handled shortly. For the time being, we cannot do anything more with them than just wait until the issue is solved on their end. However, if the issue is not fixed until the end of the next week we will fix the issue by our own, which means that contributors that have already transferred their tokens to Yobit will be compensated in full. As we have now managed to get our product development on full speed and hired a lot of new members to our team, we can put a lot more resources for exchange negotiations and listings. We will follow up with an announcement next week. Thank you and may the 2018 be successful for everyone of us!

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: A brand new account posting a next week... I assume you're one of those next-week-spammers on telegram that is not satisfied because you didn't raise enough rage on that channel, so you create a new account here (presumably to protect your real account from negative comments).  If you don't trust this coin, you already had your opportunities when the price reached 0.0008-0.0009 two weeks ago, why don't you leave at that point? Because you demand a higher price? Then you don't have any right to complain. You have your own trust on this project (because you keep holding), and when things turned to be not on your favor, well, that's the end of your right to complain.  Or was it because you don't have your token at that moment because it's stuck on yobit? Again, your fault. Devs never encourage you to send your token right away, anyone who send, they did it on their own decision, and it is a common knowledge to send small amount first to ensure the token deposited successfully before sending the entire amount.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: We will soon release our new website + roadmap Developments on web platform and Android version is going as planned MVP will be released in Q2 2018    where can i get in touch with official members?  You can get in touch with us in our Telegram Channel: https://t.me/SomaCommunity    when will the beta be released. why is there no progress to monitor on github?  Our MVP will be released in Q2 2018! More info in our new roadmap that will be launched with our new website. We sended this issue to our tech team, they are reponsible for the Github    what about the stuck coins on yobit?  Yobit is working on the problem. There tech team is working on it, thats what they promised us. We hope they will keep there word and will get it fixed this week.    how many coins have actually been supplied?  After the burn there will be a little less then 10million tokens. A more detailed amount will be released after the burn.    i heard something about a burn of coins? how many coins will be burned, how many will be left?  See answer above.    why is the slack channel closed? the telegram channel is shit, as noone is giving you any awnsers to questions.  Slack channel is closed because of all the spam there. We are doing our best to respond to all the questions asked in the Telegram channel. We are not all in the same timezone .    who is responsible for community management?  I'm community manager together with Sami. You can contact us on Telegram or here on BTCT.    why is noone concerened with community issues considering the team is not little?  Because a some people have patient and some aint.

Author: nipponbit
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: How it possible to trade at etherdelta with such TX fee? As I can see today recommended Gas Price SafeLow (Gwei): 35 https://ethgasstation.info/  When I put this gas price to ED I see: Max Transaction Fee 0.008750 ETH (10.48 USD)  Will it be real fee? or only rare maximum case? Anyway it's too much, and I'm getting warning message: "Insufficient balance for transaction"

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: That'll be because the gas limit of etherdelta is very big. You'll get max transaction fee from gas price x gas limit. I usually use ethgasstation to see if the recommended price is at what number. If they're above 50, i set the price at 12ish, and if below, around 30-50, I put 8, otherwise, 4.  It's still take few hours for me, though

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: SOMA Update  Soma team wishes happy new year to everybody in our community! The year 2017 has been an exciting year in the world of crypto and the upcoming year will be even better for those who are involved in great crypto projects, like Soma. We are delivering our MVP and SCT holders are able to utilize their tokens in the Soma ecosystem for the first time in the history, which will definitely be an exciting moment and drive the demand of SCT. We are also bringing more exchanges to increase the trading volume and liquidity of SCT in secondary markets. Lastly, we are releasing new information about one very special feature which will be implemented on the Soma platform when our new roadmap is published and start to integrate solutions from the current partnerships into our platform. We wish everybody a successful 2018!

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Isn't that a little bit counterproductive? They asked for a higher volume before they give a go on sct being listed, while (at least in my opinion) we need their exchange to lift our volume, the low trading volume is mainly because there were no decent exchange out there.  Or, we can trick the volume by revising your airdrop rule. Maybe if we put the terms where the bonus will be given to token holders from, say like, 25th of december or 1st of January, there will be a movement as people trying to accumulate more before the date of "lock down"

Author: DenysM
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: If a normal and interesting project then the volumes will be on the ED. You look at the PRL project. There daily trades for 300 thousand dollars and this token is not traded on any exchange. When a project brings something revolutionary, then everyone is interested in it.

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: If a token (or coin) has a unique feature, then yes, their daily volume will goes up by themselves due to trader's demand. But on sct case, the high volume can not be achieved or at least it would be hard to get there (and thus, it can't be listed on third exchange due to their criteria is not fulfilled) because soma gave a "lockdown rule" for their airdrop which, unfortunately, also supported by our recent condition where the only working exchange is ED. This will make people think they better hold their token due to the lack of decent exchange in hope to gain profit on the airdrop or until the third exchange announced.  Now, because most people will hold their coin until a better exchange come, there will be a low trading volume. While at the same time, the third exchange is also waiting for a decent volume to give a go. Unless one party decide to give in, we're stuck here.  Thus, I propose that soma can devise a plan to break this situation by revising their rule of airdrop, where the token "lockdown" will be effective from, like, one more week or anything. This will hopefully create a huge demand as strong investors would start bidding to gather more coin while weak hand will let their coins go because they get a decent price.  Those who want to sell quick will be happy because they can sell.  Those who want to hold more will be happy because they get their wishes.  Volume will increase and we'll meet the third exchange.  Everyone is happy

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: SOMA Update  Hello Community, I would like to announce that we are currently solving the issue with Yobit. I hope they can resolve the matter in a due course, but we are not able to do more than just push them to act promptly. We are also negotiating with other exchanges to get SCT listed and will soon release a poll for our community to vote for a preferred exchange from the current choices. We appreciate your patience in this matter. Additionally, I would like to remind that the product development of Soma is proceeding well and we are soon releasing a new website with more details about the future.

Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I am thinking about the possibility of cryptokitties' congestion actually turned us a favor. Although less likely, there is actually a possibility that people decide to hold their token on MEW due to the airdrop specification and because it is so hard (or, so expensive) to transfer token between etherchain. Or, on other scenario, they got clogged and the token entered the exchange rather slowly so the dump can be counteracted as it happened gradually.

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Technically speaking, SCT is ready for bidding (being traded) since weeks ago because they're already listed on yobit and ED. However, since no one can move their tokens from MEW or any othet wallet to those two exchanges, no one can set a sell order as they don't have any amount on the exchange's wallet. Once it got unlocked and transfer is possible, people can start moving to yobit and other exchange. Thus, start bidding.

Author: DenysM
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I think that one of the reasons for the freezing of the contract for three weeks is that they have not yet agreed with the major exchanges. yobit and delta can not be called good exchanges and perhaps the team is afraid that there will be a sharp decline. Therefore, they froze the contract and work with exchanges. I do not like what's going on lately. There are a lot of good projects and after getting on the exchanges they lose in price several times, and those tokens that do not represent anything from themselves and their project only on paper goes to the top several times.

Author: kraterion
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I think you've seen what's happening with etherdelta in the last months, since you can trade every erc20 people trade their ICO tokens right after they receive them, with huge pre-sale bonuses people makes tiny profits during ICO and they drive prices down. Solutions are, lock tokens by harcoding it into the contract so everyone will start trading together or distribute all tokens after ICO (which I don't like)

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Or maybe, maybe, the reason was simply for a sense of fairness. Initially, they planned to unfreeze the contract once they finished distributing bounties, which was planned (if I remember correctly) to be done around the 20-ish of November, but it seems due to the large participants, they got delayed and up until today (again, if I am not mistaken) there are several bounty hunters that is yet to receive their payment.  Hence, maybe the reason of locking was because they want everybody get a fair chance of dumping their coin at the best rate (we know some will dump) instead of having to sell at the post-mayhem due to receiving their payment late. This is a good strategy too, actually. I remember that there was this waves token bounty that had to experienced a rather rough path of being dumped several times because they separate their bounty payment into certain phases. This way, we only have to face one (and probably a big one) dump then we can stsrt recovering and stabilizing our rate.   I wonder if we can get hitbtc soon? They're shining these days when bittrex require some complicated KYC

Author: billy.ryoko

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: The way I get it, they mean you should not move your token from the address where it was dedicated for token distribution, either as ICO investors or bounty hunters, when the contract unlocked. That means, airdrop is specifically for those who hold coins before it get unlocked and tradable, and buying some from anywhere after the token unlock won't be considered as eligible. I can be wrong, though.

Author: billy.ryoko
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: so, is that I can't deposit it to the exchange site or more, but how about buy  it and withdrawal to my wallet?

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I'm not sure about that, whether you can be considered eligible if you buy after the token unlock or not, only the team can answer. But I personally don't think that's logical. If anyone can be considered eligible for the airdrop by buying and transferring their amount to a wallet, what stopped someone from buying at day -1 or week -1, then hold it on a relatively short amount of time if compared to other people who had hold theirs for months.  Unless there is a certain period of "lock-down", like anyone who buy before December ends and lock their tokens ever since. This will actually boost the token price after the first dump, because there will be a lot of people wanting to get hold of their own SCT before December ends, much like how people wanted to get their BTC before a hardfork.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: SOMA Update  Hello everyone! There have been a lot of questions about the amount that we have raised and what‚Äôs next. We have raised in the ICO about 560k and that‚Äôs more than enough to get our project to the next stage because of the previous angel investors. Our token will be tradable on Sunday, notice that on Yobit SCT is listed as Soma. There will be soon some news, stay tuned!  About the money raised by the angel investors: Soma has received two successful funding rounds by angel investors before the ICO. The valuation for the first angel investor round was 1,5 million. Due to confidentiality reasons I cannot reveal the exact amount. What I can reveal is that it has been hundreds of thousands of euros, which is extremely good result for a startup which didn't have any product back then.

Author: Tramirostronix
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Daniel: Hello everybody! As we promised, we are arranging an airdrop which will benefit token holders that hold SCT until the launch of our MVP product in Q2/2018. The airdrop structure has now been decided and here it is: Token owners, that hold 100-5000 SCT - 10%, token holders that hold 5000-20000 SCT 15% and finally, above 20000 SCT 20%. The unconditional rule for the airdrop is that tokens have not been transferred from the address they were allocated before the launch of the MVP.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: UPDATE  Distribution Bounty Tokens: We have started to distribute twitter bounty tokens, but it takes us some time because there are so many participants. All the other bounties are next!  Exchanges: At the moment we have Etherdelta and Yobit But we are negotiating with others, we want to add at least 1 or 2 exchanges more.  Attention: The smart contract is paused so no one can move there tokens from wallets at the moment! After we have sent everyone there tokens we will unpause the smart contract. We don‚Äôt have exact date, we will keep you guys informed.  Burning: After the distribution all remaining tokens will be burned!

Author: trugad
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Good evening. I have several questions: 1) Because of participants of a baunta of the company the coin in the first month very much will lose in price - as you are going to correct this situation? 2) What plans for growth of cost of a coin at developers?

Author: holydarkness
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I'm not part of the dev team, but I believe the situation number 1 is inevitable and happened to most coins with bounty. It is actually a good way to measure coin's strength, by looking at their ability to goes back to their initial price after the dump, and usually (if the coin and the project is deemed good enough by the investors) the price will correct themselves as those dumped coin is rightaway be bought by investors and they hold it strongly.  While for situation number 2, I'm not really clear if you mean "what will devs do with their part of coins" or "what is your plan to increase their price" ? For the former, it'll be up to the team to use them as they see fit, while for the later, aren't this info stated in the whitepaper?

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: How is it even possible to change things like the reserve? Is that not fixed in the smart contract?  https://github.com/Soma-co/soma-community-token/blob/master/contracts/SomaIco.sol  Code: function prepareLiquidityReserve() public onlyOwner {         require(isIcoFinished());                 uint256 unsoldTokens = totalSupply.sub(tokensSold);         // make sure there are any unsold tokens to be assigned         require(unsoldTokens > 0);          // try to allocate up to 10% of total sold tokens to Liquidity Reserve fund:         uint256 liquidityReserveTokens = tokensSold.div(10);         if (liquidityReserveTokens > unsoldTokens) {             liquidityReserveTokens = unsoldTokens;         }         assignTokens(liquidityReserveWallet, liquidityReserveTokens);         unsoldTokens = unsoldTokens.sub(liquidityReserveTokens);          // if there are still unsold tokens:         if (unsoldTokens > 0) {             // decrease  (burn) total supply by the number of unsold tokens:             totalSupply = totalSupply.sub(unsoldTokens);         }          // make sure there are no tokens left         assert(tokensSold == totalSupply);     }      function manuallyAssignTokens(address recipient, uint256 amount) public onlyOwner {         require(tokensSold < totalSupply);         assignTokens(recipient, amount);     }      /**      * @dev Burns a specific amount of tokens.      * @param _value The amount of token to be burned.      */     function burn(uint256 _value) public whenNotPaused {         require(_value > 0);          address burner = msg.sender;         balances[burner] = balances[burner].sub(_value);         totalSupply = totalSupply.sub(_value);         Burn(burner, _value);     }  Guess not, they are on demand functions. Both liquidity reserve and burn are optional.

Author: Yasemin
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I see now that SOMA has also a technical whitepaper, very detailed. This is what they are saying about the reward system on page 7:  Quote An item owner will have the possibility to involve other community members in promoting their product and, consequently, increase interest and trust in it.  Users that were chosen by the item owner to engage in its promotion will, after a successful transaction, be rewarded with SCT by the seller. Please note that SCTs for prizes will come from the owner‚Äôs wallet. This means that item owner will need to have SCT on his account to make his product promotable.  When a seller orders a promotion, his SCT will be transferred to the prize contract, and will remain there until a successful buying transaction occurs or when the promotion is cancelled. In case the promotion is cancelled, the SCT will return to the item owner‚Äôs wallet, after paying compensation.

Author: Pajulapoiss
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Here's some old quotes  Quote from: cantdecide on October 05, 2017, 02:19:45 PM Quote from: Pajulapoiss on October 05, 2017, 01:54:13 PM Cool project, But I couldn't really understand how does the IIC actually work?  What would be a simple real life example?  I hope I got it right. You buy something on the marketplace and the informations about this will be saved in the IIC. So, if an item will get sold and bought on the marketplace, everytime the information will be saved on the IIC, and can be tracked back to when it first got sold there.  Quote from: Voltaje on October 05, 2017, 02:41:22 PM Quote from: Pajulapoiss on October 05, 2017, 01:54:13 PM Cool project, But I couldn't really understand how does the IIC actually work?  What would be a simple real life example?  El IIC is a virtual document in the blockchain that will store all the information of an item, including how many times it was bought, it's like a history of the item, so when you buy it inside the platform, you know what the particular item has been through, the downside is that the history starts when the item enters the ecosystem, before that, you will only know the information that the seller fills in, so if it was actually bought 3 times, the first time it may actually say 1, that will depend of the veracity of the seller, of course, if it's found out that the information is false, the seller and item lose credibility, thus reducing the chances of it being bought; its a fantastic feature, and once the platform becomes mainstream, it will become essential.  I'm having a hard time understanding exactly how this if going to work... But I'm definitely curious.

Author: Yasemin
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I looked it up in the whitepaper, but there is no technical explanation yet, this is what I found on page 8   ''Rewarding System  Soma utilizes the Ethereum blockchain to create a comprehensive trading platform that leverages social capital and creates a community that aids social interaction between users. In the Soma, the contribution to the social capital in terms of value creation is materialized through User Rewarding System (URS).  URS is based on Soma Community Token (SCT), which is an ERC20 Token that is allocated inside the platform in relation to a user‚Äôs contribution individually, thus making Soma a ‚Äùperfect meritocracy‚Äù ‚Äì a model which excludes the need for third parties and provides the most efficient distribution of wealth.  The rewarding system in Soma is by nature two-fold. First, it must be recognized that every time user adds value to the community it should be rewarded for its actions. Second, the compensation must be attributed in the proportion of the value created. In Soma, this becomes reality by providing an environment that enables the exchange of social capital to SCT in the course of a bargaining at the free markets. Thus, Soma provides the ability and incentive for its users to engage in such conduct and the market mechanism ensures perfect pricing in the community.  SCT will be designed to satisfy both of these underlying ‚ÄùCommunity Principles‚Äù.''

Author: viljy
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Since for tokens there is no problem with the commission for transactions when sending microscopic amounts, tokens can be divided up to 10 ^ -18. The commission is charged by gas ETH. Accordingly, there will be no liquidity crisis, even if only one token is in circulation. Therefore, an extra 10% of tokens will only lower the price of all tokens. A compromise option might be that the extra 10% of the tokens will be sold at a price higher than the ICO. But we must take into account that this price will be the ceiling for the price of tokens in the market. Now the token costs 0.002222 .... ETH. If the developers set a firm price for an extra 10% of tokens at 0.02ETH, then there will be no significant drop in the market price. But on the other hand, tokens on the site are unlikely to be bought, as the price will be lower on exchanges. However, in the unlikely liquidity crisis, these tokens on the site will be bought at a high price. If the developers are interested in leaving these tokens to deal with the liquidity crisis, this option is acceptable for them. If they want to sell these tokens after the ICO, under the pretext of a liquidity crisis, then they will set the minimum possible price.

Author: nonconformist
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: 300$ is this per coin? Isn't it too large? But yes I think the use of decimals is an overlooked but important aspect of a coin. Just like in bitcoins, btc can be divided into 8 decimal places. and Ether can be divided in 18 decimal places. So if in the future I will buy a can of coke, the vendor will tell me, that's just 0.0000088 btc. It's not very human whereas if it's just 2 decimal places, it will be easier to transact and it is very human and easy to calculate and to understand. I don't know, for me, at least.

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Businesses on the traditional stock markets always have the option to raise more money through secondary offerings. That is not something that is possible in the cryptosphere, I think, once all public and reserved tokens are circulating. You could argue that keeping a token reserve to raise money in the future is not necessarily a bad thing.  On the other hand, trying to control the token price as if you are a central bank is frowned upon and is economically out of context. You cannot apply fractional reserve mechanisms that interact with national and international socioeconomic drivers to your company's tokens. There is a simple term for that: market manipulation.

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Regarding the liquidity reserve, I have posted before about low float stock on traditional markets. Of course you cannot directly compare stocks to tokens. But maybe there are some similarities.  I occasionally read comments from 'disappointed users' alleging that the project owners dumped all their reserved tokens onto the market after the ICO. One such example is in the Paragon thread. Even if that may or may not be true, and it can be verified through the blockchain, a big reserve held by the project owners is making some investors nervous.

Author: Sozialtourist
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Generally, I don't have a problem with the Soma team keeping 10% of the unsold tokens as a reserve but you got a good point, Rigorous.  Wouldn't it be possible to split this reserve into smaller parts and make them transferable/sellable only one after the other and only after a specific time interval? In this case, the project owners wouldn't be able to dump all their tokens at once right after the ICO.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: SOMA needs your help!  There were a lot of questions about the tokens and what will be burned and what not. We told we would hold a liquidity reserve to support the smooth functioning of the SOMA platform. We were thinking about 10% of the unsold tokens.  For the moment nothing is created, so there is no liquidity reserve. We think this reserve would help any liquidity problems with the SCT to support smooth fuctioning of the SOMA platform. If investors hold on there SCT we think there should be a problem with the liquidity. So with this reserve, users can still buy SCT after ICO to be used on the platform, this will not be at ICO price.  The devs have decided to listen to our great community. We will consider based on the feedback if the liquidity reserve will be created or not.  So please give us a well argumented feedback on what you think its best for SOMA and his future. We will listen to you guys.

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: On the traditional market there are low float stocks. The float of a stock are the publicly traded shares. A low float means a small amount of shares are in the hands of public investors and the other shares are owned by insiders. Low float stock are often very volatile and are well known for making explosive upside moves.  In the cryptosphere low float IPOs are met with more aversion. I wonder what is the underlying thought for criticizing Soma not burning the unsold shares, before we knew they will in fact burn them.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Clear answer: We will not extend ICO again, despite the fact that SegWit2x is happening!  Another answer about the collected funds: Soma has received two successful funding rounds by angel investors before the ICO. The valuation for the first angel investor round was 1,5 million. Due to confidentiality reasons I cannot reveal the exact amount.  What I can reveal is that it has been hundreds of thousands of euros, which is extremely good result for a startup which didn't have any product back then. The investor group is consisted of Finnish angel investors  I will provide you the exact amount of pre-sale + ICO later, have to check that up.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: We will burn all unsold tokens. The liquidity reserve will be burnt as well, if there is enough liquidity to support the smooth functioning of the soma platform. So to conclude - we will not sell SCT anymore after the ICO unless there would an event that there is not enough SCT on the markets to support the Soma platform. When the liquidity is reached, the liquidity reserve will be burnt.  To summarize: All the unsold tokens will be burnt

Body: The part of the technical whitepaper, that Yasemine quoted is still valid. So unless some whales get on board and buy all tokens, there will be SCTs available to buy after the ICO. Just not the whole amount of the unsold tokens. They will keep a 10% reserve for that purpose:  Here is the statement from Telegram.  "The unsold tokens will be burnt, expect the 10% liquidity reserve, which will only exist if the the ICO will not reach the hard cap. The rationale for the liquidity reserve is to ensure smooth functioning of the Soma platform in theoretical situation where onboarding users to the platform would not be able to buy SCT from the open markets. So it is a supportive SCT reserve for the platform for the unlikely event. If the liquidity reserve is not needed, these tokens will be burnt also."

Body: Im going to quote you one more time to make sure everybody read this, i was quite surprised about the contrary frankly. I was just reading about the interactive item card they are implementing, users increase the value of their published IIC‚Äôs by gaining social acceptance inside the platform.  They are also stating:  Through the social interactions known from the traditional social media platforms such as likes and followings, the ‚Äúsocial value‚Äù of the IIC is increased. Thus, users are incentivized to create high-quality content on the platform as they get rewarded for doing so. IIC contains information inserted by the users in a chronological chain about the particular physical item, such as ownership data and the condition rating. IIC transforms information of the item on a transaction-by-transaction basis. IIC will facilitate the information flow between the users, promote transparency and increase the overall trust of the community.  Cool stuff they are up to something here, they create a place where you sell and the community can help you and get rewarded for it!

Author: gliridian
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: The concept of SOMA is nothing short of revolutionary in the so called Social Markets. However, I have some reservations regarding the use of IIC's brought up in the whitepaper. IIC or Interactive Item Card is used when a seller in SOMA will register his object (to be sold of course in the market), every registered object will have their own IIC, so when it is sold to the new owner, the new owner will have the IIC of that said object. Now, let's say the owner will use the object for quite some time let's say in a year, and that owner decided to sell it in SOMA again, that object still has the previous IIC. So the challenge now is the recognition of that product. SOMA team proposes using computer vision technology to compare new item photos with older photos to confirm that the item is the same and that it hasn‚Äôt been damaged. Any changes in the item‚Äôs appearance or quality is recorded on the IIC. However, how sure are we in that computer vision tech that they will arrive on? How accurate, secure and trustworthy is that tech? What are the effects it has for the buyers? What if this tech made a mistake? There are so many questions. I think this tech is still speculative. Does the SOMA team already have a prototype working computer vision tech? Because in order for this to work, I think they need to nail this one.

Author: Pajulapoiss
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I remember being confused about this very same thing. I havent heard of this computer vision tech before, but I have to tell you, I don't have much faith in this tech you are talking about, because it still leaves too many possibilities for a mistake or misinformation in the platform.   There may not be any visual damage on the product, but it may still be damaged, for an example: tv not working.  Maybe this tech could work for electronics that are smart, that would run hardware checks and save this data in the IIC. But u can't do that on a piece of furniture  What other options could there be, for verifying the sold object?

Author: gliridian
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: While I'm not disputing the IIC tech, in fact, I'm supporting it. If they could ever pull off this one, this is nothing short of miraculous, and can open a whole lot new markets in identity and recognition. However, the concept for me is quite sci-fi at the moment. So I still have to see it to believe it.  However, I think I have a solution. Maybe they already have a prototype there already, but I doubt that it's already intelligent enough to be able to accomplish the feat they want to accomplish in my previous comment. But I think it will work just fine if, instead of just having one IIC per object regardless of it's age or owners, (because, I just can really imagine how hard will the IIC be able to keep track what's what, especially for identical objects right?) why not give a unique IIC every time someone will offer his object for sale in SOMA, eventhough it was sold before? I think that way it's ok because regardless if that object has been sold out in SOMA before or not, it still a unique identity in it's every iteration aka being offered to be sold in the SOMA.

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: You are right, I have also seen projects where the developers kept talking everyday, nowhere to be found after the end of the ICO.  On the other hand there have been several occasions where there has been a lack of communication from the team, especially after the end of their token sale. That silence causes a lot of uncertainty and a bad morale. As a result the price of the tokens have sunk dramatically. And we still do not know the status of their business.  You can see the effect of too little communication even in this thread. I have been quite cynical because there have been no answers to the questions raised in here. Then mere hours before the end of the sale the team pops in to say the sale is extended. I was excited about Soma because of the national interest they received, but if that behavior reflects the company as a whole they will have to impress me a lot from now on to dispel my doubts.

Author: SomaCommunity
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Soma ICO Extended until 15th of November Due to Big New Developments  Soma had major updates in the last week that significantly strengthen the value of our offering to potential buyers. After consulting with our advisors, we decided to extend our ICO.  SCT Now Listed On Exchanges  SCT is now listed on exchanges, such as Yobit and Etherdelta and we are in the final stages of negotiating more. Availability on exchanges is critical for everyone participating in ICOs. Extending the sale an additional 2,5 weeks will allow us to finalize more exchanges, providing additional confidence for our contributors.  New Advisors and Marketing Team  A major part of why we did the ICO was to hire a new team. We are pleased to share three new advisors who will lead our marketing.  David Passiak is the former Head of Innovation for dubizzle, the largest P2P marketplace in the Middle East where our advisor Arto Joensuu served as CEO. Arto introduced us to David, and David brought in his team of Chelsea Rustrum and Riku Luukkonen.  David and Chelsea hosted a webinar for us this past week - check out the recording - and we negotiated for them to lead our marketing moving forward. They are three of the top marketers in the world and experts in blockchain and social marketplaces.  Increased Traction and Detailed Roadmap  Our new marketing leads had a major impact in just one week. Our Telegram group grew by 400 people, we increased weekly sales transactions by 350% and website visits by 20%, and received some great media coverage including an article on Soma in Forbes  Soma have an excellent alpha product for Ios that you can test here, detailed roadmap, and with our new marketing team a solid plan on how to execute the beta launch in Q1 2018. We would love the opportunity to tell you more next week in a webinar.  David Passiak will interview our founders, followed by a live Q&A. Learn our story, vision, product roadmap. We will follow-up with an invitation to the webinar.  More Big News Coming Soon  We hope you understand the reasons why we extended the sale and look forward to answering any questions next week in our webinar. Thanks for your continued support and being with us on our journey to revolutionize how we buy and sell items.  With gratitude, The Soma Team

As a blockchain - think of a ledger or database that contains a history of all transactions that take place on the platform - the platforms are completely auditable by all participants.  This leads to fairer pricing for clients, as all prices are visible and verifiable. Potential customers are able to select the provider that best suits their needs, both financially and practically."  Satoshi wanted to create just a decentralized currency but instead he created the next disruptive tech, the blockchain

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: One thing you people may be forgetting is that historically iOS users were more likely to spend more money on online purchases compared to Android users. Maybe the demographics are shifting toward Android now though with flagship Android smartphones such as the Samsung Galaxy S8. But as of now iOS is still ahead.  https://9to5mac.com/2016/01/20/app-store-ios-downloads-vs-android-revenue/ https://www.statista.com/statistics/259510/revenue-distribution-between-the-apple-app-store-and-google-play/  And these statistics only look at app purchases, not the kind of purchases Soma facilitates.

Author: Mystic90
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: "Soma is launching 60,000,000 SCT, of which 54,000,000 will be sold in the ICO. The remaining 6,000,000 SCT units will be used for growth (marketing and rewards, including presale bonuses). Funds raised in the ICO will be used for marketing and area launches (35%), product and technology development (20%), patents and legal issues (20%), operations (15%), and community rewards (10%). The current presale is limited to 8,000 ETH and 4 weeks, while the ICO will be limited to a minimum of 8,000 ETH and a maximum of 120,000 ETH. Every 1,500 ETH raised in the ICO will be used to expand the Soma marketplace to a new region or state."  So if the ICO did not do very well, does this mean you get more SOMA tokens? Might be a good spot to put some ETH if we can get more tokens for it

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Are you familiar with Etsy? Soma reminds me a bit of it. While I still do not know what Soma's revenue streams are, I have found Etsy's:  How does Etsy make money?  Our business model is based on shared success: We make money when Etsy sellers make money. Marketplace revenue includes a $0.20 USD listing fee for each item listed and a 3.5% fee for sales completed on our website. Additional revenue comes from seller services including our advertising platform, payment processing and discounted shipping labels.

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: You don't? In some countries trading based on nonpublic information about the company is illegal. In practice insider trading in respect to IPOs is uncommon because the potential gain is low as the company is not trading yet and the IPO price is known publicly. However I see that for example India has identified a window for mischief after the drafting of the prospectus but before the listing date and is planning to regulate it. During that window price-sensitive information can be made available to insiders. With respect to Soma it is the promise of a 'good business model' that is never detailed in the whitepaper. Either this good business model is indeed very good, but then why bother hiding that information from the public?, or there is no business model at all, meaning it is an opportunity for the angel investors to sell coins acquired at a discount at the higher ICO price.

Author: FIEX
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: About those angel investors. Here is some proof:  This comes from Jukka Hilmola (Co-Founder of SOMA) on Telegram  We managed to raise funding on very early stage with 1,5M valuation from Finnish angel investors, which is a quite remarkable achievement taking into account the phase we were back then. Soma also had a minor pre-sale with a very limited publicity, mainly to have a proof of concept in the ICO markets.  We have closed two funding rounds from Finnish angel investors before our ICO. With this capital, we were able to deliver our iOS-application for testing, and very soon we are releasing a new updated version of it. This new version will include core features that are crucial for a C2C-platform. Blockchain related features are designed to be released on our MVP according to our roadmap.  We decided not include soft cap as we were already backed up by angel investments before the ICO round and ICO is a complementary round to develop our software further.  So they have Finnish angel investors and a minor pre-sale. Users in the chat are talking about a total of 6M USD but this is not confirmed by devs. Hope this info is proof

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: In addition, the basic model of classifieds sites is that they do not facilitate payments in any manner, as they are essentially a listing site. This brings its own problems, namely a security threat in some regions if there is a need handle payment in cash. You can never know the other party and its intentions, and thus there is a increased risk of fraud or robbery. Soma Community Token, and escrowed smart contract system will solve this problem in these areas.  I am not sure which classifieds sites Soma are comparing themselves to but eBay and most of the classifieds sites in my country all have a seller rating system. Some of them also feature a seller review section, where you can read experiences from buyers.  With the information I have been given so far about the Soma tokens, I remain skeptical about their potential to disrupt.

I will gladly accept a commission for this invention

Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace

Facebook have shown that, like Google, they have no qualms about harvesting every bit of personal metadata to use in targeted advertising and selling your profiles (including interests, demographics etc). Author: germsite
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: the problem is that the term illegal is difficult to define in a decentralized environment. If you have clear boundaries around a certain jurisdiction, then that is easier. I say easier because even then there are court cases on a frequent basis trying to figure out whether something is illegal or not given the existing and valid laws. I am bringing this thought up because it could lead to manipulation issues on a blockchain based marketplace. How exactly does the voting work? Is it POS based? The more shares you have, the stronger your vote?

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Barcodes are not necessarily unique to each item. Items may share the same barcode for the whole product line/model. Even serial numbers are not necessarily unique because in practice they can be model numbers which are the same for identical items. Therefore I do not believe barcodes can be used to unique identify an item and link that item to an IIC.

A few years ago Jimi Hendrix's burnt guitar was auctioned. To this day people still doubt whether it is the real thing or if it is a replica.  http://www.strat-talk.com/threads/jimi-hendrixs-original-torched-fender-strat-found.112817/ http://forums.stevehoffman.tv/threads/did-jimi-hendrix-actually-burn-a-guitar-at-the-miami-pop-festival.647676/  Whether it is real or fake, if you can make a replica of an iconic burnt guitar, you can also make a replica of its barcode. Author: cantdecide
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: I hope I got it right. You buy something on the marketplace and the informations about this will be saved in the IIC. So, if an item will get sold and bought on the marketplace, everytime the information will be saved on the IIC, and can be tracked back to when it first got sold there.

Author: Voltaje
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: El IIC is a virtual document in the blockchain that will store all the information of an item, including how many times it was bought, it's like a history of the item, so when you buy it inside the platform, you know what the particular item has been through, the downside is that the history starts when the item enters the ecosystem, before that, you will only know the information that the seller fills in, so if it was actually bought 3 times, the first time it may actually say 1, that will depend of the veracity of the seller, of course, if it's found out that the information is false, the seller and item lose credibility, thus reducing the chances of it being bought; its a fantastic feature, and once the platform becomes mainstream, it will become essential.

Author: cantdecide
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Well I bought myself some second hand lenses so far, which would be much more expensive if you buy them new. For this for example it is often written/said how many people have owned them so far, when it was bought, maybe if there was a repair needed etc. I think at this point Soma could help here because you could see if the written/said is true or not. Maybe someone wants to lie because the lens wasn't bought new from him but two persons before or something.  But I am wondering how you want to manage this with items you can't track through a serial number or something like that.

Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: The card will only work if said item is being sold and bought constantly in the platform, if it was brought before, for example, 3 times before entering the soma platform, and the one selling it doesn't know how many times it was bought, it will appear that it was just recently used,  the seller could lie too and start with a fresh second hand item, so to me at least is a little confusing the concept of the card, it can get you a security about the product, but only when it first got the platform.

Author: vitocorp
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Soma, said to be the very first Finnnish blockchain startup, is in the midst of an Initial Coin Offering (ICO).  The ICO, which started on September 26th, has reportedly raised over $240,000 in the first 48 hours.  Soma is described as a decentralized platform which facilitates trade inside their community through a rewarding system that enables beneficial collaboration of the community members. Users are encouraged to engage in actions that will benefit other members rewarding these actions with their Token: Soma Community (SCT). This bespoke cryptocurrency is designed to incentivize the members of the community to perform value-adding services efficiently with a cost-effective way of compensation. Soma, an App based platform, is said to be developing an international reputation as a Finnish pioneer in blockchain that is ‚Äúchallenging classifieds giants such as Ebay and Craigslist.‚Äù  https://www.crowdfundinsider.com/2017/09/122513-first-finnish-blockchain-startup-soma-raises-240000-first-48-hours-ico/

Author: mastrix
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Let my first post on Bitcointalk be one of puzzlement:  Why did the ICO progress bar jump from 3% to 0.21%? Did you have a minimum cap, removed it, and now it measures % of max cap reached?  Also, if max cap isn't reached, which obviously it won't, will the remaining coins be burned, or will the devs pocket the rest?  I was one of the 111 pre-salers; I am still enthused about the product itself, but I must admit the mourning process over my 7 lost eths is already well underway. They were so young, so innocent...

Author: SomaCommunity
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: The progress bar changed since it showed previously the progress of pre-sale, which had a maximum cap of 8000ETH. Now as the actual crowd sale begins, it will show the progress of it. If the max cap is not reached, the remaining tokens will be locked-up. We did have a quite minor pre-sale phase as we wanted to put substantial effort for the actual ICO round. We have currently doing good in development, our technical white paper is coming out soon, and we have partnered up with well-recognized companies in the blockchain industry to increase the exposure of the Soma project globally.

Author: mastrix
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: What exactly does "locked up" mean?  Also, thanks for the other clarifications!

Author: SomaCommunity
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: ICO specs  Soma Community Tokens will have a maximum of 60,000,000 units. We are launching 60,000,000 SCT in ICO, of which 54,000,000 are sold at ICO. The last 6,000,000 SCT units will be used for growing, marketing and rewarding active participants of ICO campaign. Funds are managed by Soma. Note that the pre sale bonuses are paid out of this (6,000,000 SCT) fund.   As for the ICO round - the funds will be utilized as follows:  35% Marketing and area launches 20% Product development and technology 20% Legal issues and patents 10% Community reward 15% Operational team   The maximum target is 120,000 ETH.  1ETH=450SCT   Our technical white paper will be soon released!

Author: Cauchy
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: Looks interesting. Will for sure Review the whitepaper when available. However 120k is a hefty sum. Look forward to hear the Communitys oppinion on this one.

Author: SomaCommunity
Title: [ANN][ICO] SOMA - The Social Marketplace
Body: This is only a theoretical maximum and not a requirement for the Soma application release. Obviously, if the crowd sale will reach the maximum cap it will decrease the amount of time to get Soma expanded across the globe in different markets since we can allocate more resources towards it from the beginning. Soma has raised capital already from the traditional funding sources and the next version of the application will be released soon for testing on our website. Thus, the capital raised from the ICO is mainly allocated to implementation of blockchain-related features of the platform and mainstreaming Soma for the large masses. The cap of 120,000 ETH is a calculated theoretical maximum which enhances the expansion of Soma and ensures the wide adoption in the beginning.
